Cornered, yet still as calm as ever.  Tucson was now beginning to whirl the=
 sword in a gyroscopic rhythym, quickening the pace until the motion actual=
ly formed beams of reflective energy, as a shield made of pure Chi surround=
s the Silver Dragon Warrior as his powerful blade swings diagonally to bloc=
k any attempts made on him.  Not one word is uttered from him, an eerie pea=
ce with explosive properties, comes in and around the Dinobots.  How well i=
t would work, depended on how they would react and be effectuated by it.

P=
erpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Sep 5, 2011, at 2:17 PM, S=
uper Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > It was al=
l about self defense. Tucson had learned that a hero never made
> > the fir=
st blow and he was not about to do that now. So with complete
> > silence, =
poise, and focus, he closes his optics, stands perfectly straight,
> > and =
drags his right foot across the ground in a slow semi circle in front of
> =
> where he stands. This blossoms into a graceful and fluid form of a
> > me=
ditative exercise similar to Tai Chi. He implements his katana in the
> > t=
ranquil dance as a dew drop falls from a branch from a tree that hangs over=

> > him. The drop lands on his sword but does not spatter. It rolls in per=
fect
> > form, over the blade, which is lowered to the ground as the dew dr=
op lands
> > perfectly intact to a fern leaf. This maneuver was known as IN=
NER PEACE.
> > The most ancient tricks in the history of Kung Fu, which was=
 also taught in
> > Ninjabot training. So as Tucson maneuvers once again, h=
is sword braces for
> > impact as he retains a highly meditative state.
> 
=
> <NEW>
> 
> So as TUSCON braced for impact, using his inner peace and kung=
 Fu
> balance the DINOBOTS do what they do best and use their might to thei=
r
> advantage.
> 
> GRIMLOCK's sword comming in high, his arm flexing might=
illy as he did
> so. He swung up and over, bringing the business end of it =
straight
> down the middle, using his weight as well as his skill and cunni=
ng to
> his advantage. He cared nothing for the seeming balance that TUSCON=

> had maintained as he brought his blade down at TUSCON
> 
> At the same t=
ime SLAG's attack came from in through the middle from
> the back as he thr=
ust foward not allowing Maximal a chance to step
> back or even move, his b=
lade perfectly timed to coincide with
> GRIMLOCK's attack as well as its an=
gle.
> 
> And if that were not enough SLUDGE and SNARL were coming in from
=
> either side, thier size and power making them both forces to be
> reckone=
d with. With vicious attacks they sought to take a bite out of
> TUSCON wit=
h razor sharp teeth!
> 
> This was a group who had fought together for cent=
uries just like this,
> in terrain much harsher than this. it was they who =
had fought their
> way out of the darkness out of defeat, carving triumph o=
ut of loss.
> They were the ones that even the combiner robots feared to fa=
ce. When
> it came to fight Unicron, they were the first ones sent in. They=
 were
> well trained, not by a master as TUSCON was, but by the sheer weigh=
t
> of years, the number of victories, their skills, prowess and mindless
>=
 ferocity were unmatched! They acted, not as seperate individuals but
> as =
one beast, each one acting in concert, always in a way that helped
> the ot=
hers to close the attack and to do as much damage as possible.
> 
> The mor=
e TUSCON would defend, the more they were close the attack, the
> more he w=
ould step away, the more they would close. If he attacked one
> then the ot=
hers would use the opening to make the hit. If he attacked
> more than one =
then others would close from the opposite side. What
> they did was driven =
as much by skill as by instinct - they knew what
> to do without even think=
ing about it. They were well armed and armored
> and knew how to use them a=
nd they would not stop!
> 
> Claws, teeth, sword and laser cannon they were=
 bringing them all to
> bear on TUSCON and they had little care for what he=
 said or did, their
> only goal was to bring him down and to do it now!
> 
=
> The battle was begining in earnest now and his choice was to fight or fle=
e!
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

ght,<br>

cle in front of<br>

d fluid form of a<br>

ements his katana in the<br>

 branch from a tree that hangs over<br>

ord but does not spatter.  It rolls in perfect<br>

e, which is lowered to the ground as the dew drop lands<br>

intact to a fern leaf.  This maneuver was known as INNER PEACE.<br>

e most ancient tricks in the history of Kung Fu, which was also taught in<b=
r>

aces for<br>

So as TUSCON braced for impact, using his inner peace =
and kung Fu<br>
balance the DINOBOTS do what they do best and use their mig=
ht to their<br>
advantage.<br>
<br>
GRIMLOCK's sword comming in high, his a=
rm flexing mightilly as he did<br>
so. He swung up and over, bringing the b=
usiness end of it straight<br>
down the middle, using his weight as well as=
 his skill and cunning to<br>
his advantage. He cared nothing for the seemi=
ng balance that TUSCON<br>
had maintained as he brought his blade down at T=
USCON<br>
<br>
At the same time SLAG's attack came from in through the midd=
le from<br>
the back as he thrust foward not allowing Maximal a chance to s=
tep<br>
back or even move, his blade perfectly timed to coincide with<br>
G=
RIMLOCK's attack as well as its angle.<br>
<br>
And if that were not enough=
 SLUDGE and SNARL were coming in from<br>
either side, thier size and power=
 making them both forces to be<br>
reckoned with. With vicious attacks they=
 sought to take a bite out of<br>
TUSCON with razor sharp teeth!<br>
<br>
T=
his was a group who had fought together for centuries just like this,<br>
i=
n terrain much harsher than this. it was they who had fought their<br>
way =
out of the darkness out of defeat, carving triumph out of loss.<br>
They we=
re the ones that even the combiner robots feared to face. When<br>
it came =
to fight Unicron, they were the first ones sent in. They were<br>
well trai=
ned, not by a master as TUSCON was, but by the sheer weight<br>
of years, t=
he number of victories, their skills, prowess and mindless<br>
ferocity wer=
e unmatched! They acted, not as seperate individuals but<br>
as one beast, =
each one acting in concert, always in a way that helped<br>
the others to c=
lose the attack and to do as much damage as possible.<br>
<br>
The more TUS=
CON would defend, the more they were close the attack, the<br>
more he woul=
d step away, the more they would close. If he attacked one<br>
then the oth=
ers would use the opening to make the hit. If he attacked<br>
more than one=
 then others would close from the opposite side. What<br>
they did was driv=
en as much by skill as by instinct - they knew what<br>
to do without even =
thinking about it. They were well armed and armored<br>
and knew how to use=
 them and they would not stop!<br>
<br>
Claws, teeth, sword and laser canno=
n they were bringing them all to<br>
bear on TUSCON and they had little car=
e for what he said or did, their<br>
only goal was to bring him down and to=
 do it now!<br>
<br>
The battle was begining in earnest now and his choice =
was to fight or flee!<br>
